intro: Viguiera adenotricha, commonly known as the Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are usually pink to purple in color. Viguiera adenotricha is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
